## Condition Evaluation Flow
``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Every Frame Check │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ │ ┌────────────────────┼────────────────────┐ ▼ ▼ ▼ ┌──────────────────┐ ┌──────────────────┐ ┌──────────────────┐ │ Difficulty ≥ 75 │ │ Within 5m of │ │ Energy > 0 │ │ │ │ guard point │ │ │ │ DifficultySensor│ │AtStandGuardPoint │ │ EnergySensor │ └──────────────────┘ │ Sensor │ └──────────────────┘ └──────────────────┘ ▼ ▼ ▼ └────────────────────┼────────────────────┘ │ ┌────────────┴────────────┐ ▼ ▼ ┌──────────────────────┐ ┌──────────────────────┐ │LastStoodGuard > 15s │ │ IsAlert ≤ 0 │ │ │ │ │ │LastStoodGuardSensor │ │ AlertSensor │ └──────────────────────┘ └──────────────────────┘ │ │ └────────────┬────────────┘ ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ ALL CONDITIONS MET │ │ ↓ │ │ Interrupt Patrol │ │ Start StandGuard │ └─────────────────────┘ ```
## Scene Setup
``` Unity Scene Hierarchy: ├── Guard (your guard GameObject) │ ├── NavMeshAgent (component) │ ├── GoapActionProvider (component) │ ├── BrainBehaviour (component) │ ├── EnergyBehaviour (component) │ ├── GuardAnimation (component) │ ├── ActionAudioBehaviour (component) │ └── [StandGuardTimerBehaviour] (added automatically on first guard duty) │ ├── Environment │ ├── StandGuardPoint_1 (empty GameObject) │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardPoint" │ │ │ ├── StandGuardPoint_2 (empty GameObject) │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardPoint" │ │ │ ├── AnglePoint_Left (empty GameObject, near StandGuardPoint_1) │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ │ │ ├── AnglePoint_Right (empty GameObject, near StandGuardPoint_1) │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ │ │ ├── AnglePoint_Left2 (empty GameObject, near StandGuardPoint_2) │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ │ │ └── AnglePoint_Right2 (empty GameObject, near StandGuardPoint_2) │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ └── GoapManager (GameObject with GoapBehaviour) └── GuardAgentTypeFactory (component) └── Capabilities List: ├── PatrolCapability.asset ├── PursuitCapability.asset ├── CatchCapability.asset ├── RechargeCapability.asset └── StandGuardCapability.asset ← ADD THIS ```
## Priority System
``` Action Priority (Lower baseCost = Higher Priority): ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Priority │ Action │ baseCost │ Trigger │ ├────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ HIGHEST │ CatchAction │ 0.1 │ At Player│ │ │ PursuitAction │ 0.3 │ See Player│ │ │ StandGuardAction│ 0.5 │ Hi-Diff │ ← NEW │ │ RechargeAction │ 4.0 │ Low Energy│ │ LOWEST │ PatrolAction │ 1.0 │ Default │ └────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
Result: StandGuard will INTERRUPT Patrol when conditions are met! ```
## Data Flow
``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ EXTERNAL SYSTEMS │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ DifficultyTracker.GetDifficultyF() → float (0.0 - 1.0) │ │ GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag() → GameObject[] │ │ StandGuardTimerBehaviour → float (seconds) │ │ EnergyBehaviour.CurrentEnergy → float (0-100) │ │ NavMeshAgent → Movement/Rotation │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ▼ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ SENSOR LAYER │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Converts external data → GOAP WorldKeys/TargetKeys │ │ • Difficulty: 0.75 → 75 (int) │ │ • AtGuardPoint: distance check → 0/1 (bool as int) │ │ • LastStoodGuard: timer → seconds (int) │ │ • GuardTarget: nearest point → Vector3 (PositionTarget) │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ▼ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ GOAP RESOLVER │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Evaluates all goals/actions → Creates action plan │ │ • Compares baseCosts │ │ • Checks conditions │ │ • Selects optimal action │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ▼ ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ STANDGUARDACTION EXECUTION │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Receives target → Moves guard → Stands for 10s → Complete │ │ • Manipulates NavMeshAgent │ │ • Controls rotation manually │ │ • Triggers animations │ │ • Starts cooldown timer │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
## State Machine
``` ┌─────────────┐ │ PATROL │ ← Default behavior └──────┬──────┘ │ Conditions met: │ • Difficulty ≥ 75 │ • Within 5m of guard point │ • Energy > 0 │ • Cooldown expired (>15s) ▼ ┌─────────────────────────┐ │ STANDGUARD - MOVING │ │ • NavMeshAgent active │ │ • Walk animation │ │ • Target: guard point │ └───────────┬─────────────┘ │ Distance ≤ 1.5m ▼ ┌─────────────────────────┐ │ STANDGUARD - ON DUTY │ │ • NavMeshAgent stopped │ │ • Idle animation │ │ • Rotating between │ │ angle points │ │ • Timer: 0→10s │ └───────────┬─────────────┘ │ Timer ≥ 10s ▼ ┌─────────────────────────┐ │ STANDGUARD - COMPLETE │ │ • Start 15s cooldown │ │ • Add timer behaviour │ └───────────┬─────────────┘ │ ▼ ┌─────────────┐ │ PATROL │ ← Resume patrol └─────────────┘ │ │ After 15s cooldown expires └──────┐ │ If conditions still met ▼ ┌──────────────┐ │ STANDGUARD │ ← Can guard again └──────────────┘ ```

# StandGuard Action - Quick Setup Checklist
## ✅ Pre-Unity Steps (Completed) - [x] WorldKeys created (AtStandGuardPoint, LastStoodGuard, Difficulty) - [x] TargetKeys created (StandGuardTarget) - [x] Sensors created (4 sensors) - [x] Behaviour created (StandGuardTimerBehaviour) - [x] Action updated (StandGuardAction.cs) - [x] Capability created (StandGuardCapability.asset) - [x] Goal exists (StandGuardGoal.cs)
## Unity Setup Steps
### Step 1: Add Unity Tags 1. In Unity, go to **Edit → Project Settings → Tags and Layers** 2. Add new tags: - [ ] `StandGuardPoint` - [ ] `StandGuardAnglePoint`
### Step 2: Create Scene Objects 1. Create guard points in your scene: - [ ] Create empty GameObject at first guard location - [ ] Rename to "GuardPoint_1" - [ ] Tag it with `StandGuardPoint` - [ ] Repeat for additional guard points (optional)
2. Create angle points for each guard point: - [ ] Create empty GameObject to the LEFT of GuardPoint_1 - [ ] Rename to "AnglePoint_Left_1" - [ ] Tag it with `StandGuardAnglePoint` - [ ] Create empty GameObject to the RIGHT of GuardPoint_1 - [ ] Rename to "AnglePoint_Right_1" - [ ] Tag it with `StandGuardAnglePoint` - [ ] Position them to define guard's viewing arc - [ ] Repeat for each guard point
**Example Positioning:** ``` AnglePoint_Left_1 | | ▼ GuardPoint_1 ──────► AnglePoint_Right_1 ▲ | (Guard stands here and rotates between angles) ```
### Step 3: Configure GOAP System 1. Find the GameObject with **GoapBehaviour** component 2. Find the **GuardAgentTypeFactory** component on that object 3. In the **Capabilities** list: - [ ] Click the **+** button - [ ] Drag **StandGuardCapability.asset** into the new slot - [ ] Verify it's in the list with other capabilities
### Step 4: Verify Guard Setup On each Guard GameObject, verify these components exist: - [ ] NavMeshAgent - [ ] GoapActionProvider - [ ] BrainBehaviour - [ ] EnergyBehaviour - [ ] GuardAnimation (or your animation controller) - [ ] ActionAudioBehaviour - [ ] PatrolRouteBehaviour (for patrol)
**Note:** StandGuardTimerBehaviour will be added automatically when guard first completes guard duty.
### Step 5: Test Setup (Static Difficulty) 1. Start Unity in **Static Difficulty Mode**: - [ ] Set difficulty to **75% or higher** 2. Move a guard within **5 meters** of a StandGuardPoint 3. Verify guard has **energy > 0** 4. Expected behavior: - [ ] Guard interrupts patrol - [ ] Guard walks to nearest StandGuardPoint - [ ] Guard stops at point (within 1.5m) - [ ] Guard rotates body between two angle points for 10 seconds - [ ] Guard resumes patrol after 10 seconds - [ ] Guard cannot stand guard again for 15 seconds
### Step 6: Test Setup (Dynamic Difficulty) 1. Start Unity in **Dynamic Difficulty Mode** 2. Play until difficulty reaches **≥75%** (you can monitor in console logs) 3. Move a guard near a StandGuardPoint 4. Verify same behavior as Step 5
## Troubleshooting
### Guard never stands guard Check these in order: - [ ] Tags are spelled correctly (case-sensitive!) - [ ] At least one StandGuardPoint exists in scene - [ ] Difficulty is ≥75 (check with `Debug.Log(DifficultyTracker.GetDifficultyF())`) - [ ] Guard is within 5 meters of a guard point - [ ] Guard has energy > 0 - [ ] 15-second cooldown has expired (check console for timer logs) - [ ] StandGuardCapability.asset is in GuardAgentTypeFactory - [ ] Unity has compiled the new scripts (check for compilation errors)
### Guard stands but doesn't rotate - [ ] At least 2 StandGuardAnglePoint objects exist in scene - [ ] Angle points are tagged correctly - [ ] Angle points are NOT at the exact same position as guard point - [ ] Angle points are visible in scene (not disabled) - [ ] Check console for log: `[StandGuardAction] Found angle points: ...`
### Guard gets stuck at guard point - [ ] StandGuardPoint is on valid NavMesh (check with NavMesh visualization) - [ ] Arrival threshold (1.5m) is reasonable for your scene scale - [ ] No obstacles blocking path to guard point - [ ] NavMeshAgent radius allows guard to reach point
### Action triggers too often - [ ] StandGuardTimerBehaviour is being added to guard (check in inspector during play) - [ ] Cooldown duration is set correctly (15 seconds in LastStoodGuardSensor.cs) - [ ] Check console for cooldown logs
### Guard stands at wrong location - [ ] Verify StandGuardPoint objects are positioned where you want - [ ] Check that objects are tagged correctly (not other objects with similar names) - [ ] Sensor finds nearest point - ensure this is the desired behavior
## Debugging Tools
### Console Logs to Watch For Look for these logs during testing: ``` [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 starting - moving to guard point at (x, y, z) [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 arrived at guard point, starting 10s guard duty [StandGuardAction] Found angle points: AnglePoint_Left_1 and AnglePoint_Right_1 [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 completed 10s guard duty [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 completed and started cooldown [StandGuardTimer] Guard_01 started cooldown at 123.45 ```
### GOAP Graph Viewer 1. Select guard during Play mode 2. Open **Window → CrashKonijn → GOAP → Graph Viewer** 3. Check if StandGuardGoal appears in the graph 4. Check if StandGuardAction is being considered 5. Look at condition values (should show difficulty, energy, etc.)
### Manual Sensor Testing Add this to a test script to check sensor values: ```csharp void Update() { if (Input.GetKeyDown(KeyCode.T)) { Debug.Log($"Difficulty: {DifficultyTracker.GetDifficultyF() * 100}%");
var timer = GetComponent<StandGuardTimerBehaviour>(); if (timer != null) Debug.Log($"Time since last guard: {timer.GetTimeSinceLastGuard()}s");
var guardPoints = GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag("StandGuardPoint"); Debug.Log($"Found {guardPoints.Length} guard points");
var anglePoints = GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag("StandGuardAnglePoint"); Debug.Log($"Found {anglePoints.Length} angle points"); } } ```
## Expected Behavior Summary
**When difficulty ≥75% and guard is near a guard point:**
1. **Interrupt Patrol** - Guard stops patrolling immediately 2. **Move to Point** - Guard walks to nearest StandGuardPoint 3. **Stand Guard** - Guard stops and stands idle for 10 seconds 4. **Rotate** - Guard slowly rotates between two angle points 5. **Resume** - After 10 seconds, guard resumes patrol 6. **Cooldown** - Guard cannot stand guard again for 15 seconds
**Priority over other actions:** - StandGuard (0.5) > Patrol (1.0) ✓ Will interrupt - StandGuard (0.5) < Recharge (4.0) ✓ Won't interrupt low energy - StandGuard (0.5) < Pursuit (0.3) ✓ Won't interrupt pursuit - StandGuard (0.5) < Catch (0.1) ✓ Won't interrupt catch
## Files Reference
All files are in: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/`
**WorldKeys/** - AtStandGuardPoint.cs - LastStoodGuard.cs - DDA/DifficultyWK.cs (existing)
**TargetKeys/** - StandGuardTarget.cs
**Sensors/** - AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs - LastStoodGuardSensor.cs - StandGuardTargetSensor.cs - DDA/DifficultySensor.cs (existing)
**Behaviours/** - StandGuardTimerBehaviour.cs
**Actions/** - StandGuardAction.cs
**Goals/** - StandGuardGoal.cs (already existed)
**Capabilities/** - StandGuardCapability.asset
## ✨ Success Criteria
Your setup is complete when: - [ ] No compilation errors in Unity - [ ] Tags exist and are applied to scene objects - [ ] StandGuardCapability.asset is in GuardAgentTypeFactory - [ ] At least one StandGuardPoint and two StandGuardAnglePoints exist - [ ] Guard interrupts patrol when conditions are met - [ ] Guard walks to guard point and stands for 10 seconds - [ ] Guard rotates smoothly between angle points - [ ] Guard resumes patrol after guard duty - [ ] Guard respects 15-second cooldown - [ ] No console errors during guard duty
---
**Need help?** Check the detailed guides: - **STANDGUARD_SETUP_GUIDE.md** - Full setup instructions - **STANDGUARD_ARCHITECTURE.md** - System architecture diagrams

# StandGuard Implementation - Complete Summary
## Overview Successfully implemented a complete StandGuard Goal/Action pair for the GOAP system that allows guards to stand at designated points when difficulty is high (≥75%). The implementation includes all necessary WorldKeys, TargetKeys, Sensors, Behaviours, and Configuration.
## Implementation Date November 21, 2025
## Requirements Met
### ✅ Action Selection Conditions - [x] **Difficulty ≥ 75** - Implemented via DifficultySensor reading DifficultyTracker - [x] **Within 5 meters of StandGuardPoint** - Implemented via AtStandGuardPointSensor - [x] **EnergySensor > 0** - Reuses existing EnergySensor from RechargeCapability - [x] **LastStoodGuardSensor > 15 seconds** - Implemented via LastStoodGuardSensor + StandGuardTimerBehaviour
### ✅ Priority and Behavior - [x] **Higher priority than PatrolAction** - baseCost 0.5 vs 1.0 (will interrupt patrol) - [x] **Walk to nearest StandGuardPoint** - Implemented in StandGuardAction Phase 1 - [x] **Stand for 10 seconds** - Implemented in StandGuardAction Phase 2 - [x] **Rotate between 2 nearest angle points** - Finds 2 closest StandGuardAnglePoint objects and rotates - [x] **15-second cooldown** - Implemented via StandGuardTimerBehaviour
## Files Created (11 total)
### WorldKeys (3 files) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/WorldKeys/`
1. **AtStandGuardPoint.cs** - GUID: `AtStandGuardPoint-a1b2c3d4-e5f6-4a7b-8c9d-0e1f2a3b4c5d` - Purpose: Tracks if guard is within 5m of any StandGuardPoint - Type: Boolean (0/1)
2. **LastStoodGuard.cs** - GUID: `LastStoodGuard-b2c3d4e5-f6a7-4b8c-9d0e-1f2a3b4c5d6e` - Purpose: Tracks seconds since last guard duty - Type: Integer (seconds)
3. **Difficulty.cs** - GUID: `Difficulty-c3d4e5f6-a7b8-4c9d-0e1f-2a3b4c5d6e7f` - Purpose: Tracks current difficulty percentage - Type: Integer (0-100)
### TargetKeys (1 file) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/TargetKeys/`
4. **StandGuardTarget.cs** - GUID: `StandGuardTarget-d4e5f6a7-b8c9-4d0e-1f2a-3b4c5d6e7f8a` - Purpose: Target key for nearest StandGuardPoint position - Type: PositionTarget (Vector3)
### Sensors (4 files) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/Sensors/`
5. **DifficultySensor.cs** - GUID: `DifficultySensor-e5f6a7b8-c9d0-4e1f-2a3b-4c5d6e7f8a9b` - Purpose: Reads difficulty from DifficultyTracker - Output: Integer (0-100) - WorldKey: Difficulty
6. **AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs** - GUID: `AtStandGuardPointSensor-f6a7b8c9-d0e1-4f2a-3b4c-5d6e7f8a9b0c` - Purpose: Checks if guard within 5m of any StandGuardPoint - Output: Boolean as integer (0/1) - WorldKey: AtStandGuardPoint - Method: FindGameObjectsWithTag("StandGuardPoint")
7. **LastStoodGuardSensor.cs** - GUID: `LastStoodGuardSensor-a7b8c9d0-e1f2-4a3b-4c5d-6e7f8a9b0c1d` - Purpose: Returns seconds since last guard duty - Output: Integer (seconds) - WorldKey: LastStoodGuard - Dependencies: StandGuardTimerBehaviour
8. **StandGuardTargetSensor.cs** - GUID: `StandGuardTargetSensor-b8c9d0e1-f2a3-4b4c-5d6e-7f8a9b0c1d2e` - Purpose: Finds nearest StandGuardPoint position - Output: PositionTarget (Vector3) - TargetKey: StandGuardTarget - Method: FindGameObjectsWithTag("StandGuardPoint"), select nearest
### Behaviours (1 file) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/Behaviours/`
9. **StandGuardTimerBehaviour.cs** - Purpose: Tracks cooldown timer per guard - Methods: - `StartCooldown()` - Called when guard completes duty - `GetTimeSinceLastGuard()` - Returns seconds since last guard - `IsCooldownComplete(duration)` - Checks if cooldown expired - Lifecycle: Added dynamically to guard on first completion - Default cooldown: 15 seconds
### Capabilities (1 file) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/Capabilities/`
10. **StandGuardCapability.asset** - Purpose: Complete GOAP capability configuration - Contains: - Goal: StandGuardGoal (baseCost: 0.5) - Action: StandGuardAction (baseCost: 0.5) - WorldSensors: DifficultySensor, AtStandGuardPointSensor, LastStoodGuardSensor - TargetSensors: StandGuardTargetSensor - Goal Conditions: - Difficulty ≥ 75 - AtStandGuardPoint ≤ 1 (within 5m) - Energy > 0 - LastStoodGuard > 15 - Action Conditions (same as goal + IsAlert ≤ 0)
### Documentation (3 files) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/`
11. **STANDGUARD_SETUP_GUIDE.md** - Comprehensive setup instructions - File reference - Unity setup steps - Testing checklist - Debugging tips - Advanced configuration options
12. **STANDGUARD_ARCHITECTURE.md** - Component flow diagrams - Condition evaluation flow - Scene setup examples - Priority system explanation - Data flow diagrams - State machine visualization
13. **STANDGUARD_CHECKLIST.md** - Quick setup checklist - Troubleshooting guide - Debugging tools - Expected behavior summary - Success criteria
## Files Modified (1 file)
### Actions (1 file) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/Actions/`
**StandGuardAction.cs** - Status: Completely reimplemented - Previous: Template with empty methods - Current: Full implementation with two-phase execution - Features: - Phase 1: Movement to guard point using NavMeshAgent - Phase 2: Standing guard with rotation between angle points - Arrival threshold: 1.5m - Guard duration: 10 seconds - Rotation speed: 2 rad/s - Rotation switching threshold: 5 degrees - Finds 2 nearest StandGuardAnglePoint objects dynamically - Starts cooldown timer on completion - Proper NavMeshAgent cleanup in End() - Animation support (Walk, Idle) - Audio support (PlayWalkLoop, StopWalkLoop)
## Files Already Existing (1 file)
### Goals (1 file) Location: `Assets/Scripts/GOAP/Goals/`
**StandGuardGoal.cs** - GUID: `StandGuard-93d03afc-596a-4217-aeb8-e83412522118` - Status: Already existed in codebase - No modifications needed
## Unity Tags Required (2 tags)
1. **StandGuardPoint** - Purpose: Marks positions where guards should stand - Applied to: Empty GameObjects in scene
2. **StandGuardAnglePoint** - Purpose: Marks rotation target points for guards - Applied to: Empty GameObjects near each StandGuardPoint - Minimum: 2 per guard point
## Integration Points
### With Existing Systems
1. **Difficulty System (DDA)** - Uses: `DifficultyTracker.GetDifficultyF()` - Conversion: 0.0-1.0 → 0-100 (percentage) - Compatible with both dynamic and static difficulty modes
2. **Energy System** - Reuses: `Energy` WorldKey - Reuses: `EnergySensor` - Behavior: Guards won't stand guard if energy depleted - Note: Standing guard does NOT consume energy
3. **Alert System** - Reuses: `IsAlert` WorldKey - Behavior: Guards won't stand guard while in alert/pursuit mode
4. **Patrol System** - Priority: StandGuard (0.5) > Patrol (1.0) - Behavior: Will interrupt patrol when conditions met - Resume: Guard resumes patrol after completing guard duty
5. **Animation System** - Uses: `GuardAnimation` component - Animations: Walk (movement), Idle (guard duty)
6. **Audio System** - Uses: `ActionAudioBehaviour` component - Audio: Walk loop (movement), stops on arrival
7. **Navigation System** - Uses: `NavMeshAgent` component - Movement: Standard NavMesh pathfinding to guard point - Rotation: Manual control during guard duty
## Priority System
Action priority hierarchy (lower baseCost = higher priority): ``` CatchAction (0.1) - Highest PursuitAction (0.3) StandGuardAction (0.5) ← NEW PatrolAction (1.0) RechargeAction (4.0) - Lowest ```
Result: StandGuard will interrupt Patrol but not Pursuit/Catch.
## Configuration Constants
### StandGuardAction.cs ```csharp private const float GUARD_DURATION = 10f; // Stand guard for 10 seconds private const float ARRIVAL_THRESHOLD = 1.5f; // Distance to consider "arrived" private const float ROTATION_SPEED = 2f; // Rotation speed in rad/s ```
### AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs ```csharp private const float PROXIMITY_THRESHOLD = 5f; // Within 5 meters ```
### LastStoodGuardSensor.cs ```csharp private const float COOLDOWN_DURATION = 15f; // 15 second cooldown ```
## Testing Status
### ✅ Code Quality - All files compile without errors - Only minor warnings (namespace conventions) - Proper GUID generation for all GOAP components - Consistent naming conventions - Comprehensive debug logging
### ⏳ Unity Testing Required User must complete Unity setup: 1. Add tags to project 2. Create scene objects (guard points, angle points) 3. Add StandGuardCapability to GuardAgentTypeFactory 4. Test in both static and dynamic difficulty modes 5. Verify behavior matches requirements
## Next Steps for User
1. **Open Unity Editor** 2. **Follow STANDGUARD_CHECKLIST.md** for setup steps 3. **Create StandGuardPoint and StandGuardAnglePoint objects** in scene 4. **Add StandGuardCapability.asset** to GuardAgentTypeFactory 5. **Test with difficulty ≥75%** 6. **Verify all behavior requirements**
## Support Documentation
Three comprehensive guides created: 1. **STANDGUARD_SETUP_GUIDE.md** - Full implementation guide 2. **STANDGUARD_ARCHITECTURE.md** - System architecture and diagrams 3. **STANDGUARD_CHECKLIST.md** - Quick reference and troubleshooting
## Technical Notes
### GOAP Integration - Follows CrashKonijn GOAP v3 patterns - Uses LocalWorldSensorBase for world state - Uses LocalTargetSensorBase for target finding - Proper GoapId attributes on all components - Compatible with existing capability system
### Performance Considerations - Sensors use `FindGameObjectsWithTag()` - cached results recommended for production - Rotation calculation per frame during guard duty - minimal overhead - Timer behaviour persists on guard - negligible memory impact
### Extensibility - All constants are configurable - Easy to add additional conditions - Rotation behavior can be customized - Guard duration can be adjusted per instance if needed
## Known Limitations
1. **Angle Point Selection**: Finds 2 nearest points globally, not per guard point - Workaround: Position angle points close to their respective guard points
2. **NavMesh Requirement**: StandGuardPoints must be on or near NavMesh - Workaround: Use NavMesh.SamplePosition in scene setup
3. **Tag-based Finding**: Uses FindGameObjectsWithTag (not the most performant) - Future: Consider caching or manager-based approach for production
## Conclusion
Complete implementation of StandGuard Goal/Action pair delivered with: - ✅ All required functionality - ✅ Proper GOAP integration - ✅ Comprehensive documentation - ✅ No compilation errors - ✅ Ready for Unity testing
User can now proceed with Unity setup using the provided documentation.

# StandGuard - Quick Reference Card
## What It Does Guards stand at designated points for 10 seconds when difficulty is high, rotating to watch between two angle points.
## Quick Setup (5 Steps)
### 1️⃣ Add Tags (Unity Editor) ``` Edit → Project Settings → Tags and Layers Add: "StandGuardPoint" Add: "StandGuardAnglePoint" ```
### 2️⃣ Create Scene Objects ``` Create Empty GameObject → Tag as "StandGuardPoint" → Position where guard should stand Create 2 Empty GameObjects → Tag as "StandGuardAnglePoint" → Position to define guard's viewing arc ```
### 3️⃣ Add Capability ``` Find GameObject with GoapBehaviour → GuardAgentTypeFactory component → Capabilities list → Add: StandGuardCapability.asset ```
### 4️⃣ Test Setup ``` Set Difficulty ≥ 75% Move guard within 5m of StandGuardPoint Guard should interrupt patrol and walk to point ```
### 5️⃣ Verify Behavior ``` ✓ Guard walks to point ✓ Guard stands for 10 seconds ✓ Guard rotates between angle points ✓ Guard resumes patrol ✓ 15-second cooldown before next guard duty ```
## Conditions (All Must Be Met)
| Condition | Requirement | Sensor | |-----------|-------------|--------| | **Difficulty** | ≥ 75% | DifficultySensor | | **Distance** | ≤ 5 meters from guard point | AtStandGuardPointSensor | | **Energy** | > 0 | EnergySensor (existing) | | **Cooldown** | > 15 seconds since last guard | LastStoodGuardSensor | | **Alert** | Not in alert mode | AlertSensor (existing) |
## Files Created
| Category | File | Purpose | |----------|------|---------| | **WorldKeys** | AtStandGuardPoint.cs | Within 5m of guard point? | | | LastStoodGuard.cs | Seconds since last guard | | | DDA/DifficultyWK.cs* | Tracks difficulty 0-100 (existing) | | **TargetKeys** | StandGuardTarget.cs | Nearest guard point position | | **Sensors** | AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs | Proximity check | | | LastStoodGuardSensor.cs | Timer check | | | StandGuardTargetSensor.cs | Find nearest point | | | DDA/DifficultySensor.cs* | Reads DifficultyTracker (existing) | | **Behaviours** | StandGuardTimerBehaviour.cs | Cooldown timer per guard | | **Capabilities** | StandGuardCapability.asset | GOAP config |
*Already existed in codebase
## Behavior Flow
``` PATROL (default) ↓ (Conditions met) MOVE TO GUARD POINT • Walk animation • NavMeshAgent pathfinding ↓ (Arrive within 1.5m) STAND GUARD (10 seconds) • Idle animation • Rotate between angle points • Smooth Slerp rotation ↓ (10 seconds complete) START COOLDOWN (15 seconds) ↓ RESUME PATROL ↓ (After 15s + conditions met) [Can guard again] ```
## ⚙️ Configurable Constants
| Constant | Value | Location | Description | |----------|-------|----------|-------------| | GUARD_DURATION | 10s | StandGuardAction.cs | How long to stand guard | | COOLDOWN_DURATION | 15s | LastStoodGuardSensor.cs | Time before can guard again | | PROXIMITY_THRESHOLD | 5m | AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs | Distance to enable action | | ARRIVAL_THRESHOLD | 1.5m | StandGuardAction.cs | Distance to stop moving | | ROTATION_SPEED | 2 rad/s | StandGuardAction.cs | How fast to rotate | | DIFFICULTY_THRESHOLD | 75 | StandGuardCapability.asset | Min difficulty % |
## Priority vs Other Actions
``` Priority: Lower baseCost = Higher Priority ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐ │ CatchAction (0.1) ← HIGHEST │ │ PursuitAction (0.3) │ │ StandGuardAction (0.5) ← THIS │ │ PatrolAction (1.0) │ │ RechargeAction (4.0) ← LOWEST │ └─────────────────────────────────────┘
Result: Will interrupt Patrol, but not Pursuit/Catch ```
## Quick Troubleshooting
| Problem | Solution | |---------|----------| | Action never triggers | Check difficulty ≥75, within 5m, tags correct | | Guard doesn't rotate | Need 2+ StandGuardAnglePoint objects | | Guard gets stuck | Ensure guard point is on NavMesh | | Action triggers too often | Check cooldown timer logs in console | | Compilation errors | Verify all files created, restart Unity |
## Console Logs
Look for these during testing: ``` [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 starting - moving to guard point at (x,y,z) [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 arrived at guard point, starting 10s guard duty [StandGuardAction] Found angle points: AnglePoint_Left and AnglePoint_Right [StandGuardAction] Guard_01 completed 10s guard duty [StandGuardTimer] Guard_01 started cooldown at 123.45 ```
## Documentation Files
| File | Purpose | |------|---------| | **STANDGUARD_CHECKLIST.md** | Step-by-step setup checklist | | **STANDGUARD_SETUP_GUIDE.md** | Complete implementation guide | | **STANDGUARD_ARCHITECTURE.md** | System architecture diagrams | | **STANDGUARD_IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md** | Full technical summary |
## Example Scene Setup
``` Hallway Scene ├── GuardPoint_Entrance │ └── Tag: StandGuardPoint ├── AnglePoint_Left │ └── Tag: StandGuardAnglePoint ├── AnglePoint_Right │ └── Tag: StandGuardAnglePoint └── Guard_01 └── Will patrol normally, then stand at GuardPoint_Entrance when difficulty reaches 75% ```
**Positioning Tip:** ``` AngleLeft | | ▼ GuardPoint ──────► AngleRight ▲ (Guard rotates head between these angles) ```
## ✅ Success Checklist
Quick test to verify everything works: - [ ] No compilation errors - [ ] Tags created - [ ] Scene objects created and tagged - [ ] Capability added to GuardAgentTypeFactory - [ ] Difficulty set to 75%+ - [ ] Guard within 5m of guard point - [ ] Guard interrupts patrol - [ ] Guard walks to point - [ ] Guard stands for 10 seconds - [ ] Guard rotates smoothly - [ ] Guard resumes patrol - [ ] Cooldown prevents immediate repeat
---
**Need More Detail?** See full documentation in: - `STANDGUARD_SETUP_GUIDE.md` - `STANDGUARD_ARCHITECTURE.md` - `STANDGUARD_CHECKLIST.md`

# StandGuard Scene Setup Examples
## Example 1: Single Guard Point at Hallway Intersection
``` North Hallway │ │ [AnglePoint_N] │ │ West Hall ──────────[●]──────────── East Hall GuardPoint_1 │ │ [AnglePoint_S] │ │ South Hallway
● = Guard standing position ```
**Setup:** 1. Empty GameObject at intersection → Tag: "StandGuardPoint" 2. Empty GameObject 3-5m north → Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" 3. Empty GameObject 3-5m south → Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint"
**Result:** Guard will rotate to look north and south, watching both hallways.
---
## Example 2: Guard Point Watching Doorway
``` ┌─────────────────────┐ │ │ │ Room │ │ │ │ │ └──────[Door]─────────┘ │ │ [AngleLeft] │ [GuardPoint]───────► [AngleRight] │ │ Hallway ```
**Setup:** 1. GuardPoint positioned in hallway facing door 2. AngleLeft points at left side of doorway 3. AngleRight points at right side of doorway
**Result:** Guard watches doorway, scanning left to right.
---
## Example 3: Multiple Guard Points in Large Area
``` Museum Gallery Layout:
[Painting 1] [Painting 2] │ │ [AngleL1] [AngleL2] │ │ [GuardPt1] [GuardPt2] │ │ [AngleR1] [AngleR2] │ │ └──────────┬──────────────┘ │ [Entrance]
[Painting 3] [Painting 4] │ │ [AngleL3] [AngleL3] │ │ [GuardPt3] [GuardPt4] │ │ [AngleR3] [AngleR4] ```
**Setup:** - 4 guard points near valuable paintings - Each guard point has 2 angle points positioned to watch the painting - Guards will patrol normally, then when difficulty ≥75%, nearest guard will stand at closest point
**Result:** Dynamic guard allocation - guards automatically choose nearest available point.
---
## Example 4: Narrow Corridor Guard
``` ┌──────────────────────────────────┐ │ │ │ [AngleBack] │ │ │ │ │ [GuardPoint] │ │ │ │ │ [AngleFront] │ │ │ └──────────────────────────────────┘ Long Narrow Hallway ```
**Setup:** - Guard point in middle of long corridor - One angle point ahead (front) - One angle point behind (back)
**Result:** Guard watches both ends of corridor, perfect for chokepoints.
---
## Example 5: Corner Guard (Wide Arc)
``` Wall │ │ [AngleLeft]──┘ │ │ [GuardPoint] │ │ └──[AngleRight] │ Wall ```
**Setup:** - Guard point at corner junction - Angle points positioned at 90° arc - Covers two perpendicular corridors
**Result:** Guard scans around corner, watching both directions.
---
## Position Guidelines
### Guard Point Positioning ✅ **Good Locations:** - Intersections and junctions - Near valuable objects/objectives - Chokepoints and doorways - Strategic vantage points - On NavMesh or close to it
❌ **Avoid:** - Dead-end corners (no tactical value) - Off NavMesh (guard can't reach) - Too close to obstacles - Overlapping with patrol waypoints
### Angle Point Positioning
**Distance from Guard Point:** - Minimum: 2 meters - Recommended: 3-5 meters - Maximum: No limit, but practical is 5-10 meters
**Angular Separation:** - Narrow watch (focused): 30-60° between points - Normal watch: 60-90° between points - Wide watch (surveillance): 90-180° between points
**Height:** - Keep at same Y-level as guard point - Guard only rotates horizontally (yaw)
---
## Unity Hierarchy Example
``` Scene ├── Environment │ ├── GuardPoints │ │ ├── GP_Entrance │ │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardPoint" │ │ ├── GP_Gallery │ │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardPoint" │ │ └── GP_Corridor │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardPoint" │ │ │ └── AnglePoints │ ├── AP_Entrance_Left │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ ├── AP_Entrance_Right │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ ├── AP_Gallery_Left │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ ├── AP_Gallery_Right │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ ├── AP_Corridor_Front │ │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ └── AP_Corridor_Back │ └── Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" │ ├── Guards │ ├── Guard_01 │ └── Guard_02 │ └── GOAP_Manager └── GoapBehaviour (with GuardAgentTypeFactory) ```
---
## Inspector Configuration
### Guard Point GameObject ``` Inspector: - Transform: Position at guard location - Tag: "StandGuardPoint" - Layer: Default - (No components needed) ```
### Angle Point GameObject ``` Inspector: - Transform: Position to define guard's view direction - Tag: "StandGuardAnglePoint" - Layer: Default - (No components needed) ```
---
## Testing Your Setup
### Quick Test in Scene View 1. Place guard point (red cube in scene) 2. Place 2 angle points (blue cubes) 3. Draw imaginary lines from guard point to each angle point 4. Guard will rotate head between these lines
### Visual Debug Helper (Optional) Add this script to test your setup:
```csharp using UnityEngine;
public class GuardPointVisualizer : MonoBehaviour { void OnDrawGizmos() { if (CompareTag("StandGuardPoint")) { Gizmos.color = Color.red; Gizmos.DrawWireSphere(transform.position, 0.5f); Gizmos.DrawWireSphere(transform.position, 5f); // Proximity range
// Find angle points var anglePoints = GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag("StandGuardAnglePoint"); Gizmos.color = Color.yellow; foreach (var point in anglePoints) { if (Vector3.Distance(transform.position, point.transform.position) < 10f) { Gizmos.DrawLine(transform.position, point.transform.position); } } }
if (CompareTag("StandGuardAnglePoint")) { Gizmos.color = Color.blue; Gizmos.DrawWireSphere(transform.position, 0.3f); } } } ```
Attach to guard points and angle points to see connections in Scene view.
---
## Pro Tips
### 1. Naming Convention ``` GuardPoint_Location_01 AnglePoint_Location_Direction ``` Example: - GuardPoint_Entrance_01 - AnglePoint_Entrance_Left - AnglePoint_Entrance_Right
### 2. Use Empty Parent Objects ``` GuardSystem_Entrance ├── GuardPoint_Entrance ├── AnglePoint_Entrance_Left └── AnglePoint_Entrance_Right ``` Makes organization easier!
### 3. Reusable Prefabs Create a prefab with guard point + 2 angle points pre-configured. Drag and drop into scene.
### 4. Level Design Integration - Add guard points during level design - Position them at strategic locations - Consider player visibility and approach paths - Balance coverage vs. exploitability
### 5. Testing Workflow 1. Create one guard point with angle points 2. Test with one guard 3. Adjust timing/rotation as needed 4. Duplicate and position for other locations
---
## Common Patterns
### Doorway Watcher ``` Guard faces door, rotates ±45° to scan Angle points: Left/Right of doorframe Use case: Entrance security ```
### Hallway Patroller + Guard ``` Patrol route with guard point in middle When difficulty high, guard stops and watches both ends Use case: Long corridors ```
### Room Center Guard ``` Guard in center, 4 angle points at room corners Creates 360° surveillance effect (finds 2 nearest) Use case: Large open rooms ```
### Stairway Watcher ``` Guard at top/bottom of stairs Angle points: Up/Down the stairway Use case: Vertical chokepoints ```
---
## Troubleshooting Scene Setup
| Problem | Solution | |---------|----------| | Guard doesn't find point | Check tag spelling (case-sensitive) | | Guard doesn't rotate | Need at least 2 angle points near guard point | | Guard rotates wrong direction | Reposition angle points | | Guard walks but doesn't stop | Guard point might be off NavMesh | | Guard rotates 360° | Angle points are at same position |
---
## Final Checklist
Scene Setup: - [ ] At least one GameObject tagged "StandGuardPoint" - [ ] At least two GameObjects tagged "StandGuardAnglePoint" - [ ] Guard points are on or near NavMesh - [ ] Angle points are positioned 3-5m from guard point - [ ] Angle points define reasonable viewing arc - [ ] Named clearly for organization - [ ] Tested with one guard first
Unity Tags: - [ ] "StandGuardPoint" tag exists - [ ] "StandGuardAnglePoint" tag exists
Capability: - [ ] StandGuardCapability.asset added to GuardAgentTypeFactory
Ready to test!

# StandGuard Action Setup Guide
## Overview The StandGuard action allows guards to stand at designated guard points when difficulty is high (≥75%). Guards will move to the nearest StandGuardPoint, remain there for 10 seconds while slowly rotating between two angle points, then have a 15-second cooldown before they can guard again.
## Files Created
### WorldKeys (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\WorldKeys\) 1. **AtStandGuardPoint.cs** - Tracks if guard is within 5m of a StandGuardPoint 2. **LastStoodGuard.cs** - Tracks time (in seconds) since last guard duty 3. **Difficulty.cs** - Tracks current difficulty percentage (0-100)
### TargetKeys (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\TargetKeys\) 1. **StandGuardTarget.cs** - Target key for the nearest StandGuardPoint
### Sensors (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\Sensors\) 1. **DifficultySensor.cs** - Reads difficulty from DifficultyTracker (0-100) 2. **AtStandGuardPointSensor.cs** - Checks if guard is within 5m of any StandGuardPoint 3. **LastStoodGuardSensor.cs** - Returns seconds since last guard duty 4. **StandGuardTargetSensor.cs** - Finds nearest StandGuardPoint position
### Behaviours (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\Behaviours\) 1. **StandGuardTimerBehaviour.cs** - Component that tracks cooldown timer per guard
### Action (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\Actions\) 1. **StandGuardAction.cs** - Main action implementation (UPDATED)
### Capability (C:\Users\Soya\Documents\Dev\AAU\MED7\DOAP-Difficulty-Oriented-Action-Planning\Assets\Scripts\GOAP\Capabilities\) 1. **StandGuardCapability.asset** - GOAP capability configuration
## Unity Setup Steps
### 1. Add Unity Tags In Unity Editor, add these tags: - **StandGuardPoint** - For the guard position markers - **StandGuardAnglePoint** - For the rotation target markers (need at least 2)
### 2. Create GameObjects in Scene Create the following GameObjects:
#### StandGuardPoint Objects 1. Create empty GameObjects where you want guards to stand 2. Tag them with "StandGuardPoint" 3. Position them in strategic locations (hallways, intersections, etc.)
#### StandGuardAnglePoint Objects 1. Create at least 2 empty GameObjects near each StandGuardPoint 2. Tag them with "StandGuardAnglePoint" 3. Position them to define the guard's rotation arc - Example: Place one to the left and one to the right of the guard point - The guard will rotate to look between these two points
### 3. Configure Guard Agent Type In your GuardAgentTypeFactory (on the GameObject with GoapBehaviour): 1. Add the **StandGuardCapability.asset** to the Capabilities list 2. The action should automatically be higher priority than PatrolAction (baseCost = 0.5 vs 1.0)
### 4. Verify Sensor Setup The StandGuardCapability.asset includes all required sensors, but verify in Unity Inspector: - DifficultySensor → Difficulty WorldKey - AtStandGuardPointSensor → AtStandGuardPoint WorldKey - LastStoodGuardSensor → LastStoodGuard WorldKey - StandGuardTargetSensor → StandGuardTarget TargetKey - EnergySensor should already exist (from RechargeCapability)
## Action Behavior Details
### Conditions (All must be met) 1. **Difficulty ≥ 75** - High difficulty threshold 2. **Within 5 meters** of any StandGuardPoint 3. **Energy > 0** - Guard has some energy 4. **LastStoodGuard > 15 seconds** - Cooldown has expired 5. **Not Alert** - Guard is not in alert/pursuit mode
### Action Priority - **baseCost: 0.5** (lower than PatrolAction's 1.0) - This means StandGuard will **interrupt PatrolAction** when conditions are met
### Execution Flow 1. **Movement Phase**: Guard walks to nearest StandGuardPoint 2. **Arrival**: Guard stops when within 1.5m of target 3. **Guard Duty (10 seconds)**: - Guard stands idle - Slowly rotates body between two nearest StandGuardAnglePoints - Rotation speed: 2 rad/s - Switches direction when within 5° of target angle 4. **Completion**: - 15-second cooldown timer starts - Guard returns to previous behavior (likely patrol)
### Animation States Used - **Walk** - While moving to guard point - **Idle** - While standing guard (during rotation)
### Audio - **PlayWalkLoop()** - While moving to guard point - **StopWalkLoop()** - On arrival
## Testing Checklist
- [ ] Tags created: "StandGuardPoint" and "StandGuardAnglePoint" - [ ] At least one StandGuardPoint GameObject in scene - [ ] At least two StandGuardAnglePoint GameObjects near each guard point - [ ] StandGuardCapability.asset added to GuardAgentTypeFactory - [ ] Difficulty is set to ≥75% (test with static difficulty mode) - [ ] Guard has energy > 0 - [ ] Guard is within 5 meters of a StandGuardPoint - [ ] Guard interrupts patrol when conditions met - [ ] Guard walks to guard point - [ ] Guard stands for 10 seconds, rotating between angle points - [ ] After 10 seconds, guard resumes patrol - [ ] Guard cannot stand guard again for 15 seconds
## Debugging Tips
### Check if Action is Available Look at the GOAP Graph Viewer in Unity to see if StandGuardGoal/Action is in the plan.
### Console Logs The action includes debug logs: - `[StandGuardAction] {guardName} starting - moving to guard point at {position}` - `[StandGuardAction] {guardName} arrived at guard point, starting 10s guard duty` - `[StandGuardAction] {guardName} completed 10s guard duty` - `[StandGuardAction] {guardName} completed and started cooldown` - `[StandGuardTimer] {guardName} started cooldown at {time}`
### Common Issues 1. **Action never triggers**: - Check difficulty is ≥75 - Verify guard is within 5m of StandGuardPoint - Check 15-second cooldown hasn't expired - Verify tags are correct
2. **Guard doesn't rotate**: - Need at least 2 StandGuardAnglePoint objects - Check angle points are tagged correctly - Verify angle points are positioned properly (not on top of guard)
3. **Guard gets stuck**: - Ensure StandGuardPoint is on NavMesh - Check NavMeshAgent is properly configured - Verify arrival threshold (1.5m) is reasonable for your scene
## Advanced Configuration
### Adjusting Timing In `StandGuardAction.cs`: ```csharp private const float GUARD_DURATION = 10f; // Duration of guard duty private const float ARRIVAL_THRESHOLD = 1.5f; // Distance to consider "arrived" private const float ROTATION_SPEED = 2f; // Rotation speed ```
In `LastStoodGuardSensor.cs`: ```csharp private const float COOLDOWN_DURATION = 15f; // Cooldown between guards ```
### Adjusting Priority In `StandGuardCapability.asset`, change: ```yaml baseCost: 0.5 # Lower = higher priority ```
### Adjusting Conditions In `StandGuardCapability.asset`: - Change difficulty threshold (currently 75) - Adjust proximity check (currently within 5m) - Modify energy requirement (currently > 0) - Change cooldown duration (currently > 15 seconds)
## Integration with Existing Systems
### Difficulty System - Uses `DifficultyTracker.GetDifficultyF()` to get current difficulty (0-1) - Converts to percentage (0-100) for GOAP conditions - Works with both dynamic and static difficulty modes
### Energy System - Reuses existing Energy WorldKey and EnergySensor - Guards won't stand guard if energy is depleted - Standing guard does NOT consume energy (guards remain idle)
### Alert System - Reuses existing IsAlert WorldKey - Guards won't stand guard while in alert/pursuit mode - If guard spots player during guard duty, will abort and pursue
### Patrol System - StandGuard has higher priority than Patrol (lower baseCost) - Will interrupt patrol when conditions are met - Guard resumes patrol after completing guard duty
